resource.chars:
<s>Explanation of the Figures.
Fig. 1. A highly magnified figure of the animal 
taken from its shell. The margin of the mantle 
and several of the ciliated arms have been re-
-moved in order to show the tentacula & ocelli 
more distinctly, but the lateral jaws, lingual sac 
& acoustic capsules, are seen through the trans-
parent covering of the body. The pectinate gill 
occupying the dorsal region, with a faint outline 
of the heart at its posterior extremity, the foot,
& the mass of the liver need no special references 
Fig. 2. A figure of the shell (natural size ).
Fig. 3. A much enlarged figure of the same.
Fig. 4. A foreshortened view of the shell show-
ing the shape of its mouth with the notches in 
its outer lip, and the four rows of small tubercu-
-lations noticed in the text.
Fig. 5. A small portion of the lingual ribbon &
Fig. 6. A side view of the lateral jaws, both of 
which are highly magnified. -<\s>
